events.message: The applicant has formally submitted a personal loan application to cover upcoming medical expenses and consolidate existing debt.
The loan application has been categorised under personal loans due to the stated purpose related to medical debts and personal expenses.
A loan officer experienced with personal and medical-related loans has been assigned to handle the application and assist the applicant.
During the initial review, the loan officer verified the completeness of the submitted personal loan application and flagged some missing financial details.
Additional documents including recent medical bills and income verification statements were requested to support the application.
The applicant has promptly submitted all requested documents including medical invoices, bank statements, and proof of employment.
Credit check was completed and shows a moderate credit score with some past debts that have recently been settled.
The risk assessment identified medium risk primarily due to outstanding debt levels but acknowledged steady employment income.
A loan offer including terms for a personal loan to cover medical expenses was presented to the applicant with a fixed interest rate.
The applicant responded with questions about the repayment schedule and requested a slight extension in the loan term.
Application was escalated to the senior underwriter due to the applicant’s request for revised repayment terms.
After review, the loan was approved with adjusted terms to accommodate the applicant’s request for an extended repayment period.
Funds were successfully disbursed to the applicant’s bank account to cover the medical bills and consolidate previous debts.
A follow-up was conducted to ensure the applicant is managing repayments well and to offer assistance if needed during the loan period.
The personal loan application process has been closed successfully, with all stages completed and the applicant satisfied.
